channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Ikea to open new store at Jem
item.description:
May 11, 2020 12:25 PM

SINGAPORE - Swedish retailer Ikea will be expanding to the west and opening its third outlet in Singapore at Jem in 2021.

item.title: MP Low Yen Ling down with dengue fever as Singapore enters peak season for the disease
item.description:
May 11, 2020 12:21 PM

SINGAPORE - Senior Parliamentary Secretary for Education and Manpower Low Yen Ling has come down with dengue fever, placing her among the hundreds of people who have fallen ill in recent days as Singapore enters its peak season for the disease.

item.title: 900 ST School Pocket Money Fund beneficiaries to get Mr Bean care packs of soya treats
item.description:
May 11, 2020 11:46 AM

SINGAPORE - Packs of sweet treats will soon be on their way to 900 beneficiaries of The Straits Times School Pocket Money Fund (STSPMF) to boost their spirits during the circuit breaker period.

item.title: Coronavirus: Direct School Admission exercise to open on May 12, with selection process going virtual
item.description:
May 11, 2020 11:12 AM

A total of  146 secondary schools and 20 junior colleges are participating this year in DSA.

item.title: Man allegedly left home multiple times after given stay-home notice
item.description:
May 11, 2020 9:44 AM

Teo Say Leong, 64, allegedly spent about an hour outdoors around his neighbourhood on each occasion.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on May 11
item.description:
May 11, 2020 7:40 AM

Good morning! Here are our top stories to kick-start your Monday, May 11.

item.title: SFA recalls mushroom products with excessive sulphur dioxide levels
item.description:
May 11, 2020 5:00 AM

Five types of mushroom products are being recalled after sampling has shown them to contain excessive levels of sulphur dioxide, which could potentially induce allergic reactions.

item.title: McDonald's resumes delivery, takeaway services from today
item.description:
May 11, 2020 5:00 AM

McDonald's will resume its delivery, takeaway and drive-through services from today, the fast-food chain announced in a Facebook post yesterday.

item.title: Two councils in stand-off over running of one condo estate
item.description:
May 11, 2020 5:00 AM

A refusal by one management council (MC) of a condominium development to hand over to another council after its term ended has led to the first reported case of two councils appearing to run one estate.

item.title: Zoo closed? Penguins get to go on excursion instead
item.description:
May 11, 2020 5:00 AM

The 14 African penguins in the Singapore Zoo have started on a new routine since the zoo closed on April 7 - the first in its history - to curb the spread of the coronavirus.

item.title: All passengers on SIA flights must wear masks
item.description:
May 11, 2020 5:00 AM

All passengers on Singapore Airlines (SIA), SilkAir and Scoot flights will be required to have their own mask with them and wear it throughout the flight.

item.title: Messages for foreign workers - translated with love
item.description:
May 11, 2020 5:00 AM

Words of support from Singaporeans for the foreign worker community battling Covid-19 tend to get lost in translation but a new initiative is helping the message get through.

item.title: DPM Heng heartened by firms that return, donate wage subsidy payouts
item.description:
May 11, 2020 5:00 AM

Thirty-two companies have returned their Jobs Support Scheme (JSS) payouts and will turn down future payouts under the scheme, while others have pledged to donate the money to charity instead.

item.title: Buddhist charity donates relief bags to Sri Lankan students studying here
item.description:
May 11, 2020 5:00 AM

The lockdown in Sri Lanka in March and April to stem the coronavirus spread made many Sri Lankan students in Singapore worried.

item.title: AskST@NLB talks return via podcast on May 22: Life in Wuhan after virus
item.description:
May 11, 2020 5:00 AM

What does a city look like after it reopens from a coronavirus lockdown? How has the Chinese city of Wuhan, where the virus was first detected, changed because of Covid-19?

item.title: Volunteers sew 50,000 masks for the vulnerable
item.description:
May 11, 2020 5:00 AM

Having to undergo chemotherapy did not stop retiree Amy Lee, 71, from doing her part for charity.

item.title: Pushing on for better health
item.description:
May 11, 2020 5:00 AM

Having a very balanced lifestyle, laughing a lot and running after my dog, an 11-year-old adopted French bulldog.

item.title: Coronavirus: Singapore firms trying to retain foreign staff, but this group likely first to go
item.description:
May 11, 2020 5:00 AM

Such workers are a mainstay of the economy, with around 1.15 million employed here, including those on employment passes, S passes and work permits. The number excludes foreign domestic workers.

item.title: Hospital befrienders lend sympathetic ear to migrant worker warded for Covid-19
item.description:
May 11, 2020 5:00 AM

Even after Mr Murugam Pillai (not his real name) was warded at Alexandra Hospital for over a week after being diagnosed with Covid-19, his family in Tamil Nadu remained unaware of his condition.

item.title: Tech to help workers in dorms monitor their health
item.description:
May 11, 2020 5:00 AM

With the management of foreign workers in dormitories entering the recovery phase, the workers are being given help to monitor their health through telemedicine and a gadget that checks blood oxygen levels.

item.title: Challenging times for some workers as firms try to rein in costs
item.description:
May 11, 2020 5:00 AM

Things went south pretty quickly for part-time aquarist Yee Jiaying when the Covid-19 outbreak hit Singapore.

item.title: Out of quarantine arises gratitude
item.description:
May 11, 2020 5:00 AM

Within hours of the aircraft touching the tarmac, Singaporean Joshua Koh and his family were taken from Changi Airport to a place they had not heard of and where they had to stay for two weeks.

item.title: Recognising 'super mums' of kids with special needs
item.description:
May 11, 2020 5:00 AM

Chel Sie was just over a year old when she was diagnosed with a rare chromosome disorder, which had caused part of chromosome 18 to be deleted. Later on, she would also be diagnosed with autism spectrum disorder (ASD).

item.title: Tough job search bears fruit, but with pay cut
item.description:
May 11, 2020 5:00 AM

In March, following a three-month job search and nearly 100 applications, Mr Sukaimi Sukri was getting increasingly worried about his chances of finding employment.

item.title: Help aplenty: Job for homeless man, breast milk delivered to baby in KKH
item.description:
May 11, 2020 5:00 AM

A chance encounter on Good Friday at a community club (CC) helped turn around Mr Patrick Foo's life.

item.title: New mother grateful for mum's help in raising child
item.description:
May 11, 2020 5:00 AM

Mother's Day this year held special meaning for first-time mum Tam Xiang Ying as she celebrated the occasion yesterday with her own mother and baby daughter by her side.

item.title: British director of Singapore firm unable to sustain business
item.description:
May 11, 2020 5:00 AM

A British man's investment of close to half a million dollars and ambitions of building a company here have become just one more casualty of the coronavirus and the measures taken to counter it.

item.title: Woman held for assaulting cop, refusing to wear mask properly
item.description:
May 11, 2020 5:00 AM

A second person has been remanded at the Institute of Mental Health (IMH) for psychiatric evaluation after an episode in public involving face masks.

item.title: Precautions stepped up for workers, volunteers at Expo facility
item.description:
May 11, 2020 5:00 AM

Volunteers eating at the Singapore Expo community care facility (CCF) will now be separated by a clear screen, one of many protective measures put in place in response to infections emerging at the facility.

item.title: Employees, bosses flood business associations for advice
item.description:
May 11, 2020 5:00 AM

Employers and employees alike are thronging key agencies such as business associations for advice on a host of issues amid the pandemic.

item.title: Home in focus: Faces behind the masks
item.description:
May 11, 2020 5:00 AM

Tomorrow is International Nurses Day, which honours the important work that nurses do. It is also the birthday of Florence Nightingale, the founder of modern nursing who has profoundly influenced modern healthcare.

item.title: Four Covid-19 cases among non-patients raise concerns
item.description:
May 11, 2020 5:00 AM

In just over a week, four confirmed cases of Covid-19 emerged among healthcare workers and volunteers at the Singapore Expo community care facility (CCF).

item.title: Vaccine in demand
item.description:
May 11, 2020 5:00 AM

People queueing outside a health centre in Outram Road for smallpox vaccinations in April 1959. The police were also there to maintain order.

item.title: Nearly 250 students to get laptops with online learning resources
item.description:
May 11, 2020 5:00 AM

Nearly 250 students in Singapore will receive new laptops that can aid in their learning in an initiative rolled out by the United Overseas Bank (UOB) and its partners, including Singtel and Singapore Press Holdings (SPH).

item.title: 33 false positives from test kit error; first imported case in two weeks
item.description:
May 11, 2020 5:00 AM

The Ministry of Health (MOH) said yesterday that 33 Covid-19 cases from a laboratory were false positives due to an apparatus calibration issue for one of its test kits.

item.title: Singaporean remains in Rwanda to pilot flights ferrying people, aid
item.description:
May 11, 2020 5:00 AM

Pilot Suzanna Seng has made four trips to Guangzhou, China, to bring back medical supplies to Rwanda.
